oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Rain believed to be ridden by sorcerers. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-27. 8399 rev. and 8400 rev., note). |han=kass'o was told by his elders that dead people (who come out of the ground) are those who 'rode the Rain' (when living) and thus do so again (they are rain-sorcerers). 1) |han=kass'o heard this from his maternal grandfather (Tsatsi), as well as from his maternal grandmother (=kammi) and another person (called Tuai-an), 2) This story is found in Book VIII-27.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dead people are those who rode the Rain
